intro: Spilanthes papposa, commonly known as the hairy pappose bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pappose (feathery) seeds that aid in wind dispersal. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Spilanthes papposa is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
